intro: Alsine crispa, commonly known as the curly alsike, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, succulent stems and small, white or pale purple flowers arranged in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in meadows and along streambanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a wavy or curled margin, giving it a distinctive appearance. Alsine crispa is an annual or biennial herb that blooms from late spring to early summer.
